image.altText: A sign on a school building.

props.synopsis: Brindabella Christian College has sought to "set the record straight" on its financial status in a letter to parents and staff after it was revealed the Australian Taxation Office had commenced court action against it to recoup an $8 million debt.

title.children: Canberra private school says $8 million debt to ATO 'misleading'

image.altText: Orange cones circle space around a tree

props.synopsis: Four Year Six students were injured when a branch fell from a tree during a school excursion at Government House, with one taken to hospital in a critical condition.

title.children: Schoolgirl critically injured during visit to Government House in Canberra

image.altText: damaged gravestones

props.synopsis: The 180-year-old Queanbeyan Riverside Cemetery is home to its fair share of ghost stories, urban myths and legends, but locals fear for its future due to a lack of maintenance and vandalism.

title.children: Historical cemetery known for floating coffins and ghost stories in grave danger

image.altText: a bearded man wearing a blue suit and sunglasses walks in front of the ACT Magistrates Court

props.synopsis: It took a jury three days in the ACT Supreme Court to find Aleksander Ivanovski guilty of removing a condom during an encounter with the victim in 2021.

title.children: Man found guilty of stealthing sex worker at Canberra brothel

image.altText: Health Minister Rachel Stephen-Smith addresses media.

props.synopsis: ACT Health Minister Rachel Stephen-Smith has conceded she was first made aware of patient demand outpacing health service funding before last year's October election.

title.children: ACT health minister warned of budget woes before election

image.altText: a woman with brown hair holds a ginger cat

props.synopsis: Canberra is widely considered 'the most renter-friendly' city, but amid constant legislative changes in favour of tenants, that title may be coming at a cost to landlords, with investors leaving the ACT.

title.children: Canberra 'the most renter-friendly' city to live in — but it comes at a cost

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: Angus McKay, 32, will serve two months in prison of an 18-month jail sentence, in what is the first sentencing in Canberra following a major review of sexual assault cases.

title.children: Families clash outside Canberra court after man jailed for raping former friend

image.altText: Soccer players wearing green, black and white uniforms smile at each other during a game

props.synopsis: One year on since learning of Canberra United's financial strife, the story remains unchanged — their financial situation hasn't improved, an investor is yet to come on board, and the window for a men's bid has passed. So what can be done?

title.children: Uncertain future for Canberra's only professional football team

image.altText: an older couple holding hands with their rates bill on the dining room table

props.synopsis: Yass Valley is one of many local councils staring down a budget black hole. It blames the federal government for cutting funding but it's likely ratepayers will be the ones slugged to balance the books.

title.children: Retirees Anne and John faced a tough decision after receiving rates bill

image.altText: A woman wearing a dark green blazer standing in front of a window.

props.synopsis: Many children in Australia with fetal alcohol spectrum disorder — or FASD — won't be diagnosed until they are involved in the criminal justice system. But with the right supports, kids can thrive.

title.children: The 'invisible' disability that's rarely diagnosed until a child's in prison

image.altText: Forecast map

props.synopsis: The weather system is one of two tropical lows looming around Australia, creating strong winds along most of Queensland's coastline. Some modelling shows it moving as far south as the Wide Bay region.

title.children: Cyclone tipped to form on Sunday could move as far south as Wide Bay

image.altText: an old 2028 image of serial rapist Graham James Kay getting into a car after leaving court

props.synopsis: NSW Police were called to a pharmacy in Sydney's CBD about 6pm on Friday, where they were told a 16-year-old girl had been sexually touched by a man not known to her.

title.children: Serial rapist jailed after allegedly sexually touching teen girl in Sydney

image.altText: A woman with short grey hair speaking. She is wearing a green suit jacket and seated in front of a blue flag

props.synopsis: Foreign Minister Penny Wong presses China to be more transparent about the actions of its warships off Australia's east coast after they issued a live fire drill warning at short notice on Friday.

title.children: Wong challenges Chinese counterpart over 'unprecedented' live fire drills

image.altText: A composite image of a bearded Johnny Damon with the Red Sox and a clean-shaven Johnny Damon with the Yankees.

props.synopsis: The New York Yankees will allow beards for the first time in 49 years, after owner Hal Steinbrenner removed a policy implemented by his father at the Major League Baseball club in 1976.

title.children: Yankees mocked over press conference announcing reversal of beard ban

image.altText: Beaumont children photographed at the Twelve Apostles.

props.synopsis: A private team is embarking on a fresh dig for answers to one of Australia's most enduring mysteries — the disappearance of three young children in suburban Adelaide on Australia Day in 1966.

title.children: Dig begins on Beaumont-linked site nearly 60 years after disappearance

image.altText: Pope Francis sitting on a white chair during a service.

props.synopsis: Pope Francis is not in "immediate danger of death", his doctors say, but the 88-year-old's condition remains "fragile" as he battles respiratory issues in a Rome hospital.

title.children: Pope not in 'immediate danger of death' but condition remains fragile

image.altText: A young man in a collared shirt and bulletproof vest sits in a courtroom.

props.synopsis: Police officers who arrested Mr Mangione found him with a 9-millimetre pistol and silencer, clothing that matched what was worn by Mr Thompson's shooter, and a notebook describing an intent to "wack" an insurance company CEO, according to a court filing.

title.children: Luigi Mangione 'illegally searched' during arrest, lawyer tells court

image.altText: A person in scrubs and gloves holds a petri dish.

props.synopsis: Three people have died from melioidosis in the Townsville area which follows four deaths from the disease in the Cairns region.

title.children: Protecting yourself from an 'unprecendented' outbreak of melioidosis

image.altText: Hands reach to grab two cocktails off bar grate at a bar.

props.synopsis: There's no colder gaze than that of an oncologist who is ensuring that you have really understood what she has said.

title.children: How an oncologist's cold gaze made me rethink my alcohol intake

image.altText: People jump out of the exit of the aircraft

props.synopsis: Everyone survived the Delta Air Lines Flight 4819 crash-landing in Toronto this week, but the incident has undoubtedly raised questions about whether aviation disasters are increasing in frequency and the safety of flying in the future.

title.children: Possible lack of 'flare' during Toronto crash landing observed by experts

image.altText: police at setting up a crime scene on a suburban street

props.synopsis: A teenager is in custody after a 76-year-old man was killed when a car crashed into his mobility scooter south of Brisbane.

title.children: Teen allegedly ran stop light before 76yo struck on mobility scooter struck

image.altText: CFA crews and fire truck on scene in arid paddocks in central Victoria

props.synopsis: A grass fire near communities of Forbes, Kilmore, Springfield and Willowmavin has been brought under control after more than 30 fire crews attended the blaze.

title.children: Grass fire brought under control north of Melbourne

image.altText: The silhouette of a firefighter carrying a rake and standing in front of bright red and orange flames

props.synopsis: Los Angeles Fire Department chief Kristin Crowley was dismissed by Mayor Karen Bass amid a rift over who should take responsibility for the city's deadliest-ever disaster.

title.children: LA fire boss sacked by mayor over response to deadliest-ever wildfire

image.altText: The exterior of a modern concrete building with a sign out front reading "High Court of Australia".

props.synopsis: One of the trio of men awaiting deportation to Nauru has avoided the need to urgently challenge his removal, with the Immigration minister promising he would not be removed from Australia while the case continues.

title.children: Urgent legal challenge to Australia's paid deportation to Nauru avoided

image.altText: A drawing of a weatherboard house which has a roof that is changing colour from black to white.

props.synopsis: Australian research has found a fluorescent film placed on top of "super cool" roof materials can solve glare problems while maintaining a comfortable temperature inside homes.

title.children: Red, green or orange roofs could 'super cool' your home

image.altText: A Merino wether sheep with horns in the foreground with men looking at the pen of wethers being sold.

props.synopsis: The national mutton indicator and national processor cow indicator both lifted by 10 per cent this week. Here's what happened.

title.children: Mutton prices 'going bananas' as Aussie red meat in demand

image.altText: Farmer Michael Hastings smiles while holding a bucket of emergency silage, beside a tractor

props.synopsis: Buried under a dry mound of dirt on Michael Hastings's farm is an insurance policy he had hoped he would never need.

title.children: Farmer keeps secret drought weapon buried on property for 18 years

image.altText: A man and woman stand smiling in front of a Labor banner. In the foreground are hands holding up phones taking photos

props.synopsis: SA's Premier Peter Malinauskas says the Whyalla steelworks takeover was like his marriage proposal, an elaborate plan with 'lots of moving parts'. It was a long time in the planning, but when it came, the government acted swiftly and without warning, writes Leah MacLennan.

title.children: SA Premier compares stress of Whyalla move to marriage proposal

image.altText: Libby Mettam speaks at a microphone as Nick Goiran watches on.

props.synopsis: In a campaign where the Liberals need everything possible to go their way, this week has delivered few opportunities for optimism — instead, the headaches just kept coming.

title.children: WA Liberals endure bruising week as election race gets tough

image.altText: Indigenous footballer squats with arms spread wide in celebration after a goal

props.synopsis: Just a few years after teaching himself photography on a borrowed camera, Jesse Pickett is thrilled to be sitting on the AFL sidelines.

title.children: Iconic snap of Bobby Hill captured by self-taught photographer

image.altText: A man in front of a wind turbine

props.synopsis: Some farmers see possibilities, some see a blight on the landscape, amid a significant growth of wind energy in WA's agricultural heartland.

title.children: A new type of farm sparks debate and opportunity in WA's Wheatbelt

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and glasses looks ahead

props.synopsis: Sanjeev Gupta, who emerged as the unlikely saviour of Europe's heavy industry 15 years ago and then the saviour of Whyalla, now presides over companies facing legal action, closure or sale.

title.children: Inside Sanjeev Gupta's rapidly shrinking business empire

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: The RBA can't say so but it is entirely possible many mortgage borrowers won't have to hand over hundreds of dollars to their banks this year.

title.children: Millions of mortgage borrowers could soon be thousands of dollars better off

image.altText: A black and white photo of a woman and an older man wearing a hat and glasses.

props.synopsis: Researchers have established Australia's first motor neurone disease surveillance centre in a region where residents are three times more likely to contract the disease.

title.children: Groundbreaking MND research hub opens in disease hotspot

image.altText: Charles Perkins and other members of the Freedom Ride at Bowraville, NSW, in 1965 State Library of New South Wales

props.synopsis: They were pelted with eggs and chased out of town, but these Indigenous-led protesters forged a lasting legacy in the fight against racial segregation.

title.children: Barred from pubs, pools and RSLs, these activists never gave up the fight
